Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: If you have your own transportation and you're looking for a business hotel outside of the city center, this place will serve just fine. It's a functional hotel with contemporary design and free parking. The public areas, especially the staircase, are reminiscent of a school or a retirement home, but they've tried to spruce it up with modern furniture and funky paintings. Most of the staff is friendly and helpful. The wine is good, but the food was mediocre at best. The rooms look exactly like the pictures on their website. They are clean, light and spacious enough. There are plenty of conveniently placed plugs so you can charge all your devices easily. Wi-Fi costs 8 euro though and is flaky. The bathroom was clean, but small and the water pressure is on the weak side. The pillows are clumpy and need replacing. It was very quiet though - no noise from either the street, the corridor or next door neighbors. If you are looking for functional, this hotel works. If you're looking for charm, look for it elsewhere. Especially if you're on a sightseeing trip, you may want to stay closer to the center, as the hotel is located in between a residential and business area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: vladislavs999
Reviews.Content: While hotel itself is pretty good, the inconvenient location makes it less than perfect choice. Consider you transportation carefully before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Choice for Pets and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: GinJess
Reviews.Content: If you value Customer Service or are traveling with a Pet then this is NOT the hotel for you. Hotel was reserved and paid in advance through Hotels.com - The hotel was selected, because it was advertised as pet friendly; budget cost; near the Van Gogh Museum. The manager would not let our dog stay in the hotel, because she was too large (there was no information on the Hotels.com site saying that there was a pet size restriction). The manager would not refund our money when we had to leave to find a hotel where our dog would be welcome. The hotel is not located near the Van Gogh Museum (as their website indicated). This hotel is a 10-minute walk from a tram stop. The tram ride is 20-minutes to tourist destinations. There is a lovely Holiday Inn nearby which allows pets of any size - Is slightly more per night in cost - And is next to a tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good impression”
Reviews.Author: magdati
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly spacious, clean room with a modest, plain but clean bathroom (no mould stains or other attractions). There was a kettle in the room, they possibly could have provided a tray but a towel did a great job as a table / cloth:) I just can't say a bad thing about the room. Maybe the choice of music channels was non-existent, otherwise I would only say positive things about the hotel. Plus the staff were a massive plus - they were naturally (I mean it) courteous and helpful. In terms of the location, once you get over the fact that you have to walk some 8 minutes to the tram / metro station, the link to the centre of the city is great. If you are after value, this hotel was a great choice. BTW I think that breakfast at any hotel is a massive mistake and you are into much more fun if you explore local cafes or local produce even if you have to consume it from a hotel towel:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, bad location”
Reviews.Author: HUSA4342
Reviews.Content: Room was nice, free laundry on the 3rd floor, which is slow as heck. parking was free, wifi was spendy as usual here. had to walk like ten blocks to a 25 min tram ride to downtown, that really sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated office building, near the RAI”
Reviews.Author: Joliechef
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good value for the price. The rooms are modern, clean and very well isolated. The plains flew over our head but I did not hear a thing. Breakfast is good altough I think the price is somewhat high. (20 euro) Parking below the hotel, very secure. (15 euro a day) Busstop nearby and metro about 15 minutes walk. - There is only free WIFI in the hotel lobby for 1/2 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with excellent staff, rooms and breaksfast”
Reviews.Author: punitworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel as part of business trip wherein ten of us stayed for 3-5 nights. Hotel is conveniently located and is accessible by public transport. Also offers car parking. Rooms are very spacious, infact quite large, are well maintained and have all amenities. Rooms are very quiet and offer good sleep. Breakfast is very exhaustive with a lot of variety. WiFi is only free in Lobby. In addition, the staff is very helpful and always willing to support your queries. Happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet & very good place to stay - a hotel with a distinct character”
Reviews.Author: Krishnan R
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip to Amsterdam and stayed at NH Musica, Amsterdam. Our team of about 10 stayed there as well. A very informal lounge and bar puts it away from most large commercial hotels with 4 and 5 stars !! Rooms are very large, neat and self sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracyofnorfolk
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a friend to attend some futball matches in the area. The hotel was in between the 2 locations so that worked well for us. The room was clean and modern. We separated the beds which were made up individually as requested. There was a nice desk area and the tv was on the wall in front of the beds. The bathroom was modern with a small bottle of shampoo and small bottle of body wash. I liked the magnifying make up mirror. The staff at the front desk were pleasant and helpful. The hotel was packed with business people and flight attendants. We had drinks at the bar one evening. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant as it was 19 euro each for breakfast if we ordered that when we checked in or 22.50 euro if we walked in the next morning. We drove down the street and found a great little shop that had amazing sandwiches and coffee. For 10 euro we were ready to go! The laminate floors were scratched and scraped up, leaving them looking dirty. The bathroom had the very familiar (though I cannot understand the attraction) glass partition Â½ wall (so water splashes out of the shower no matter how careful you are) and removable shower head. The shower head had low water pressure. A door or shower curtain would have been much easier, cleaner, and save on all the towels it takes to absorb the water. I just donâ€™t get that design??? The hair dryer was mounted in the bathroom in front of the mirror, but we both used flat irons and had to plug them in the bedroom. There was no other mirror to use except for the one mounted inside the closet-made doing our hair difficult. The hotel places several thermoses of coffee near the door so you can make a cup on your way out. Great concept, but by far the worst coffee I have ever had. Really. The bar felt like a Holiday Inn Express buffet breakfast roomâ€¦ with a bar. When our husbands arrived on the last evening, we went down for a drink. We had to sit at a table with chairs. Couches, chairs, ambient lighting etc. would have been much nicer. This was the lobby. The area in front of the elevators had 2 massage chairs that cost 2 euro per time slot. A bit tacky in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value conscious hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ksionline
Reviews.Content: It's a little out of the way from the city area, but the quiet of the street makes up for it. The trains (underground and tram) are a 10-15 minute walk away. Bus stop is right in front. Night service bus service is a 5 min walk away. Clean and well kept. Free breakfast (pastries) m-sa. Full breakfast on Sunday free!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as NH Utrecth”
Reviews.Author: sk_sajjad
Reviews.Content: Wasn't anything great about this place. Out of all the NH hotels, this didn't attract me much. Location wise it was fine, however the services were not upto the mark as it was in other NH Hotels. The only good thing was that they could arrange for a taxi whenever I needed one. I would rate the overall experience as 'Average'

Reviews.Title: “Practical place”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Zelf
Reviews.Content: I spent several nights in Musica and must conclude it is just one of those business hotels. everything is just fine and dandy however if it weren't because of the location (close to the office) I would not use it. Location is inbetween Amsterdam and the next suburb out ( Amstelveen). So, no complaints, it's just that if you visit Amsterdam, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Serg095
Reviews.Content: Convenient location not far from Amsterdam WTC, business center and airport. However just below the pace for descending planes. Far from downtown, no bars or restaurants at walking distance except for the hotel restaurant. Lobby bar closes at 24.00.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for your buck !”
Reviews.Author: manair
Reviews.Content: The style is contemporary - the rooms were neat and the bathroom spacious - loved it !This hotel gives you maximum bang for your buck. I have to agree about the bed though - two beds put together which slides with every move. But then it was comfy and we had no problems sleeping. The hotel is approx 6 km from the city center. There's a bus stop right opposite the hotel - the bus to Schipol airport stops there. Besides that there's a tram station few blocks away - took us straight to the city center in 10 - 15 min. Just ask for the bus/tram map at the reception and get an iamsterdam card from any gas station (there's one nearby). We found very few dining options near the hotel - there's a pizza place right opposite and that's it. One more thing - the hotel seemed to be understaffed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Titamxnl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Food was ok and we liked the rooms. The only thing we didnt like was the bed. There we two one person bed put together and the bed would move easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Turnberryodn
Reviews.Content: Rooms are beautiful and practical. Lots of space and nice shower. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but location sucks”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_6282
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sleek, modern finishings everywhere. Its spolessly clean and spacious for a double. The check in was friendly and quick. Breakfast was good, with a limited selction. The only gripe I have is that the location of the hotel is not that great. Its in a (mostly) residential part of Amsterdam, quite far fro the sights and sounds. The only consolation, is that there is a bus stop right outside the hotel with a bus route that take you right into the city. Would not recommend to tourists who are in Amsterdam for a quick stay, unless you value a quality hotel more than location.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have been to!”
Reviews.Author: CityTripGirL_RoX
Reviews.Content: The past 6 months I have been staying at the NH Musica for several stays. At first I wasn't all that enthusiastic about how the building looks like from the outside. But this is just a facade. The personnel is really very friendly. I always arrive very late in the evenings (after 23h) and even then nothing is too much to ask. The rooms are very nice and large. There is a possibility to make your own hot water (to drink). There is a hair dryer present. Breakfast in the morning is the best! You have everything you could wish for, hot and cold drinks/food, fruit, every kind of tea. The hotel isn't that far from Amsterdam City, so I really would recommend this for a Citytrip to Amsterdam. Nice to know is that they have a late checkout!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Kosher Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Dalhousie1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the very south of Amsterdam. Although it is away from all the action in the centre of town, it is very tranquil, clean, air-conditioned and modern. It is also very near several kosher restaurants, grocery stores and religious facilities. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful in organizing our excursions. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel south of city”
Reviews.Author: PrinzaufderErbse
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located south of the business district, one train stop and a few metro stops away from the airport in a quiet residential area. It seemed to be mostly used by business travelers and flight crews. It is 10 min. by foot from a tram stop of the tram that takes you to the city centre (around 15 minutes from the museum quarter). For tourists it could be worth considering a more central location. Yet for the price for this hotel you might not get a hotel of the same standard downtown. The hotel offers nicely decorated rooms, probably recently refurbished, of modern design. The beds are very good. The room was of medium but totally sufficient size, with a wooden floor, a bed, a desk and a built-in wardrobe with safe. There was a coffee and tea set free of charge. The modern design bathroom had a luxurious shower and sink, yet no tub. The overall impression was good. The outer appearance of the hotel does no justice to the very accomodating atmosphere of the rooms. On Sunday you can ask for a late check-out at 17:00 (great) for no extra charge and breakfast is served until noon. Breakfast buffet at 22,50 Euros a person was not cheap, yet acceptably priced. The buffet offers a wide range of savory dishes (from saussages to asian curry) as well as cheese and cold cuts or sweet treats like muffins or cake. The orange juice is fresh with pulp (the refrigerated type) and delicious. Overall I can recommend the hotel yet if I could get a more central location for the same price I would opt for that when visiting as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: kfhm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Musica while on a 1 day "layover" in Amsterdam. The hotel is very nice and very modern. Rooms were good size, very clean with all the amenities. The staff was very well trained and excellent to deal with. The only draw back is the location. It is not in the city center. Access via public transport was possible just a little complicated. From the city center you would either take a tram and connect to the bus (Tram 4 connecting to Bus 62 (I think)) or take Tram 5 or Metro 53 (?) and make a 7 minute walk. While this was fine for me, some people would not like it. Overall I recommend the hotel. Wifi only free in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: mmmicecreammm
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Amsterdam with 2 friends a day earlier than planned and we booked this hotel on a whim through a tourist office. It turned out to be a fantastic decision and we were very impressed from the moment we arrived! The staff were wonderful, the rooms refreshing and spacious and the breakfast was delicious! There is a tram stop about 10 mins walk down the road and a bus stop straight out the front that goes to Amsterdam Centraal, so even though the hotel is a fair way out of town, the public transport is very convenient. I just wished we booked this hotel for our whole stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great find...with parking too!”
Reviews.Author: travelingsenior
Reviews.Content: I had a car and heard stories about the lack of parking and cost of parking in the Amsterdam hotels. Luckily, this hotel had openings. My only experience with NH Hotels was the previous night's stay near the flower fields. This hotel is much different. First, the cost was over twice the cost of the previous hotel, however, very comparable to other hotels in Amsterdam. I chose this hotel because of its free parking and within walking distance to the tram. I got a room over twice the size of my previous night's room and very modern. The room was setup perfectly for a business customer. with a nice, long desk. The rooms are quiet. The hotel is in the pathway of the airport, and I could not hear the jets. It had a hot water pot, cups, glasses...and a towel warmer. The staff was very nice and offered me places to visit and eat. They even looked up the hours of certain museums that I wanted to visit with very little prompting. They had printouts and maps so that I didn't have to try to remember how to get from the hotel to the tram stop and what number/stop name it was. The walk to the tram was a nice walk, however, had the weather been miserable, it would have been a miserable walk. I was told that the area was safe to walk in, even after dark. I walked from the tram back to the hotel and the neighborhood was quite quiet. For anyone who has a car in Amsterdam and is willing to walk to take the tram into Amsterdam, I heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All what a modern hotel should offer to the business traveller.”
Reviews.Author: PeterSGhent
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel and it provides all what is needed for the business traveler. The rooms have an airy atmosphere and are remarkably quiet. Even when airplanes are making their final decent over Amstelveen to Schiphol, which is sometimes the case. The rooms are new, clean, modern and very well aired which is a bonus for a good night's sleep. The bathrooms are modern with spacious showers. The restaurant is more than decent and offers a variety of good wines and excellent fresh dishes. Although it is not super-cheap.... Especially the breakfast with it's 22â‚¬ is overpriced, even when you pre-book at check-in and get 5â‚¬ discount.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be judged by its cover”
Reviews.Author: JMcoupleinc
Reviews.Content: First impressions was not much to look at from the outside but then we were pleasantly suprised that the foyer was well presented and the staff were very friendly. After a efficient check-in we went up to the room to find a smallish but well presented room, the size was not an issue for us as we were only sleeping here. The ensuite was small but practical and well appointed. The beds were king singles pushed together with king single covers which from first impression looked a little underdone but suprisingly warm. My wife and I noted the beds on a floating wooden floor were like beds on ice so we did not risk cuddling in the centre for fear of falling between the gap :) The upside was that we were typically tired from our adventures, that sleeping in a single was not a problem. The room for us was a bit cold at first but the temp can be manipulated a little either way to adjust for comfort, we also mentioned at the front desk and they gave us a portable heater which was a nice gesture but with that and the kettle going would trip the power breakers, so not advisable to rely on this option. The hotel offers other features which are typically left to the occupier to discover, my tip is to read the room manual before doing anything else. Happy travels

Reviews.Title: “Not in the centre but excellent value”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisMH
Reviews.Content: We have lived in Amsterdam so know that for value you need to stay outside the central area and so we stayed at the NH Musica based on Trip Advisor reviews. It was exaclty was we thought it would be. The surrounding area is residential with the shopping facilities of Glederlandplein nearby and plenty of good local restaurants within a 30 minute walk (on Scheldestraat and Beethovenstraat). Having lived in Amsterdam we knew the south part of the city was the best and not so touristy with plenty of bars around the Pijp area and were happy with the location of the hotel given the price. We booked a junior suite for less than we'd have paid for a normal room in the centre and the hotel felt new and recently refurbished and the suite was nice and spacious with two bathrooms. Breakfast was included and that was perfectly fine. We had absolutely no problems during our stay and walked into the centre and back which gives you a chance to see the real Amsterdam away from the tourist infested centre. When we are in Amsterdam again we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable room & bathroom”
Reviews.Author: meexxx
Reviews.Content: This may sound a bit corny, but I liked everything! :) The hotel met all my expectations. The room price was very attractive, living room and bathroom very well equipped. apartment size of a small apartment in Poland. Access to the city by tram No 5 in 15 minutes. I could live there permanently;) Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, far far out of the city centre”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel for the price I was given during the period of stay with friends. The hotel is definitely way too far out of the city centre and takes a 10 - 15 minutes walk before you get to the closest tram stop. From there the tram would take you another 20 minutes before you get anywhere near the centre. The hotel is set in what seemed to be a residential area with a pizzeria close by. Business centre facilities will cost you an arm and a leg, but then again that's the true for all NH hotels. Having said all that, the staff were quiet incredible and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The rooms were elegant, spacious and clean. The sleep quality was just about good. The hotel, given its location, is very quiet. I would stay there again if I am just wasting time and taking it easy during the day. If nightlife is your purpose for visiting Amsterdam, you will need a taxi to get back and there's nothing else you can do about it. The good thing is, from the hotel, you can take a taxi straight to the airport and wouldn't be cheaper than taking the train from Amsterdam Centraal if you have a couple of friends with you.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel, fair distance from the city centre though.”
Reviews.Author: CIngX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend at the end of April 2010 over the Queen's Day period. It is an incredibly busy time in Holland and particularly in Amsterdam so the fact this hotel is a little way out from the city centre made it ideal for us as the contrast between the madness and crowds of the city and the tranquility of this hotel was perfect. We got a great deal on the room including breakfast and stayed 2 nights in total. I thought the decor of the room and the quality of finish was exceptional. The beds were comfy and clean and sleep quality was good as it was very quiet even though it was busy. The staff were very helpful too. At breakfast food quality was good with a lot of choice. We also tried room service which is quite a limited menu but was good when it arrived. Amsterdam, as with any city, is easy to get around in if you use the trams or underground so please don't be put off by the location of this hotel. You may even find that you like the fact it gives you a different perspective of Amsterdam by being in a suburb.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location not as bad as you think”
Reviews.Author: lawsons33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to do the marathon ,hotel is very clean ,rooms are very good ,the staff are excellent ,there are shops near by (5 min walk ) and the location is not as bad as it seems ,catch the 165 bus out the front of the hotel and that takes you to the station (3 min ) away there you can get the train or tram to central station in 20 mins or even the bus to the airport ,we usually like to stay more central but this hotel is fantastic and we will stay here again for sure ,and if you are doing the marathon the 165 bus takes you straight to the start ,

Reviews.Title: “Served a purpose - comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Rach383London
Reviews.Content: I was a bit optimistic about staying here after reading the reviews. It wasn't so much the hotel in itself but the distance into the city centre everyone had commented on. However after staying there this weekend, I can say that I don't think it was as bad as some of the reviews make it out to be. It is easy to get to from the airport, the first stop Zuid-WTC station on a train toward Utrecht (6 mins), then from the train station you have three options: walk (about 20mins); jump on the 165 bus which stops right outside the hotel (about 5 mins), or take the no5 tram and then a 5-10min walk to the hotel. As for getting into the city centre, we used the no 5 tram, which took about 10-15 mins. Itâ€™s a great way to see the city and easy to jump on and off at the various parts. The only down side we found that was if you stayed out past midnight, then it was tricky to get back - it was a 30euro metred taxi ride - so none negotiable, otherwise jump on one of the last trams just before midnight and it's no problem. The hotel itself was clean, comfortable and staff were pleasant. It was perfect for our stay, as we were out and about all day, only really needed a bed to crash on that wasn't expensive and I got a good deal for two nights (Â£106) on the bidding website. If I was to go to Amsterdam again I would have no problems staying here again although I'd probably try to stay closer to the centre only just to get more of a feel for the Amsterdam that you go to see - canals and period buildings rather than apartment blocks and office buildings in the area of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “near airport, expensive breakfast, far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: flapfluit
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks like an old office building witch they turned into a hotel. The hotel is near airport Schiphol, so plains are one and of, and that is realy noisy. Breakfast is very expensive. They charge â‚¬45,= for 2 persons. That's outrageous! The city centre is at 30-40 minutes traveling by foot and tram. Rooms are clean, bathroom nice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: musquashroot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own for a conference, which was located 15 minutes walk away. Although I was prepared to be a good distance away from the central city, I found my daily walk to and from the hotel to be picturesque and tranquil. The housekeeping is especially diligent, with my toiletries replenished generously and the room always sparkling clean every evening when I returned. When I had the time to do more sightseeing, the number 5 tram stop is a short 8 minute walk away and has frequent trams into the busier parts of town.

Reviews.Title: “not memorable, but nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: anouk2211
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern and clean, bathroom was spacious and modern too. Only disappointment was that your double bed consists of two twins Breakfast was fabulous, with wide choice of hot and cold meals, everything was fresh and tasty. But If not included it costs 17 euro, maybe too overpriced. Staff were all very helpful and friendly, especially room service and reception. Location isn't very good for amsterdam sightseeing. Its typical outskirt. It takes about 15 min walk to the nearest 5 tram stop and another 20 min to the city center. But the hotel has free parking, that can be seen as a real gem for car travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Thankfully away from the madness”
Reviews.Author: idontdrivetractors
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a 40th birthday present for myself and travelled solo. Its about a 15 minute walk to Zuid train station (1 stop from Schiphol) which also has a metro service which goes towards Centraal . If you turn to your left after leaving the hotel, then take the first right, tram number number 5 can be found slightly over 5 minutes walk away. This service goes through Museumplein,Leidseplein and onto Centraal. If you buy an advance ticket giving unlimited travel for between 1 to 3 days, the cost is very reasonable. The NH Musica is in Amsterdam's financial area and seems to be geared towards business travellers. The very large rooms have a crisp,modern feel and the bathroom is also immaculate with plenty of room. All the hotel's staff were very helpful without being intrusive. One of the previous reviews mentioned the cost of items in the minibar; everything is between 4 and 6 euros. This shouldn't be a concern as there is an Albert Heijn supermarket about a minute away. I got a very good deal on this hotel through Traveline (about Â£50 per night) and have nothing but good things to say about it. However, if you have never been to Amsterdam before and are travelling alone, do not venture into the red light district alone after dark as, even if you don't have any intention of indulging in any of the seedier things that go on, someone will approach you with an offer to sell substances illegal even there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fresh Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sombochris
Reviews.Content: Got a really good deal on this hotel. It is really Clean inside the bedrooms are fresh and spotless. The Bar is very efficient with frosted beer glasses- yum yum. The hotel rents scooters, the locals use the cycle lanes on their scooters and don't use helmets, worth giving a go. A good restaurant nearby in the park, with shopping centres giving you a real taste of Dutch Life. Thogh it is a bit out of the centre the train is about 1km away. Once you stay here you would never stay in the centre of Amsterdam. Felt really safe and refreshing

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel itself, but very poor location, probably for someone with cars”
Reviews.Author: SanSancia
Reviews.Content: We got there from the central station of amsterdam, then took a tram to the "nearest" stop, but still we had to walk for about 15 minutes... I think it's really catered for business travellers or someone with cars and using taxis... we booked this hotel, 'cos there was a super promotion on an online travel agent, which offered only GBP 10 for one night!!! but with the hotel's name/exact location unknown before you paid. so we only knew that the hotel was located far far away from the central station only after the payment. anyway, the price was reali worth as long as you had a bit extra time for commuting. The room was very clean and light. our booking excluded breakfast. but there was gym facilities, though we didn't hv time to use them. staff were all very friendly and helpful, though their english was not very good but we could still communicate well.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, New Hotel, TOO FAR, NOT in central Amsterdam or close!”
Reviews.Author: danimartini
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through lastminute.com as a 'secret hotel'. The place itself is newly renovated & stunning. But it's a 15 min walk, then a tram ride of 4 stops to the nearest station (Amsterdam Zuid), then a transfer to another rail to downtown - so 45 mins+ one way. We caught the bus to the station one day and we had to pay becuase this hotel is out of the city limits - outrageous!! The ONE good thing is it's about 3 stops on the main rail from the airport and closer to the Keukenhof Tulip gardens. I would NOT recommend it here as there is no atmostphere in the neighbourhood, it feels like suburbia. The money you save you have to spend on transportation there! ps. the breakfast was an outrageous non-budget 17 Euro!!

Reviews.Title: “Spanking new!!!”
Reviews.Author: keanureeve
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 sunny days in June. The Hotel itself is a converted office block, so it looks a bit boring art deco fom the outside, but inside it's ultramodern and spanking new. The rooms are a good size, with a study desk, flat screen telly in the wall, top quality furnishings and squeeky clean spacious bathroom. Room service is young and friendly. So this is the hotel's strongest selling point. One dispointment is that there's only 10 double bed rooms in the hotel, so if you're one of those people who hates sleeping on a sheet pulled over 2 twins (They also had a double woolen blanket, but no double duvet), then I suggest you confirm exactly what you are getting before booking. I thought I'd hate the the together twins, but I actually didn't take much notice in the end as everything else was so nice. Distance from the canals is a small issue. It is a 10-15 min walk to the tram/metro station, and then a 30-40 minute ride to Centraal. Or you could get off somewhere on the way if you like. (eg the canals, Rembrantsplein, Rijkmuseum etc). It's quicker by Metro, but the wife preferred the tram as she found it quite charming and picturesque. Do get yourself a whadoyoucallit ticket sheet as it works out cheaper. Do remember that everything in the minibar costs 5 euros or so. Even a small packet of peanuts or M&Ms! I ended up gorging down 30 euros worth of stuff, before I read the fine print purely by chance. (Found the leaflet which had dropped on to the floor). Overall, a pleasant stay, the very discerning wife loved it too, so that says a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, but far”
Reviews.Author: southfew
Reviews.Content: Booked this place by bidding on Priceline after seeing the Trip Advisor forum on getting great deals by blind-bidding on Priceline. Paid US $65 a night for four nights and was very happy with that, but disappointed when I realized how far away I was from anything. I'm a 38 years old male and was in Amsterdam by myself to see the sights. I agree with the reviews here that say the hotel was nice and a good value, but the extra transportation costs probably detracted from the value. Was tired after the long flight so lazily took a taxi from the airport, which was about 30 Euro. Tried to take the Connexxion from the airport, which advertises as dropping off passengers at NH Musica, among many other places, but the driver and others didn't know where it was (or didn't want to drive there). I showed the taxi driver my hotel confirmation and he got me there just fine. Short nap and then got out and walked. Ended up walking all the way to Centraal Station. With a stop for Thai food and a detour through Vondelspark, it took a few hours. Taxied home for about 20 Euros. The next day I bought a 72 hour tram ticket at Zuid and began using the tram the rest of the way. There are two stops on the #4 line about a 10-15 minute walk away. If you have a backpack, you can use the tram, but any larger luggage, I wouldn't recommend due to the distance and the sometimes crowded trams at peak times. The tram hits Museumplein, Leidesplein, and Centraal Station - it's about twenty minutes to Leidesplein and the last train leaves southbound (toward NH Musica) from Leidesplein shortly after midnight. If you want to stay out later, your options are taxis or renting a bike. If I stayed at NHMusica again, I might just rent a bike. There is a bike shop directly across the street but the worker there told me they don't rent bikes that you can only rent bikes "downtown." That's probably the cheapest option if you stay at NHMusica and aren't on a business expense account: tram to the center city, rent a bike, and use it for your stay. If I stayed at NHMusica again, that's what I would do. As far as the hotel goes: 1. very slow elevators for the apparent newness of the place (it made me thing the building is actually a bit older and had a previous life as something else). 2. there is a small bar area directly next to the check-in counter. 3. there is a restaurant that never seemed to have much activity, off of the lobby. The rooms: 1. at check-in, I was given a choice of a shower or a tub. picked a shower and was pleased with the pressure and hot water. 2. the bed was king-sized but that was two pushed-together double beds 3. flat screen tv on the wall 4. hardwood floors were very nice 5. half-price on the minbar (beer, wine, water, snacks). One advantage of the location was that, if you are a jogger, it was very easy to jog east the the river and Amstel Park (about five minutes away jogging) for a nice circuit. I did a longer run south along the Amstel River and was in the country very quickly. There was a nice path all along and I went five miles south and back. That was a nice unexpected perk of the hotel's remote location. It really was as far south as Amsterdam as possible while still being within the city limits. I'd stay there again and would recommend it, if you get a tram pass or a bike or are traveling on an expense account. The rooms are good but I missed being in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Low-Cost Top Quality Accommodation on the Outskirts of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mark241
Reviews.Content: Located a 15 minute walk south from the Amsterdam Zuid station and business district, the NH Musica is a brand spanking new hotel, providing a high level of comfort to its guests. Rooms feature plush, stylish 4-star furnishings with soft, comfortable bedding, flatscreen TV, wooden flooring, and a lovely bathroom and great toiletries. There's an in-room safe, wired broadband (6 EUR for 60 minutes of use in a 24 hour period), and the hotel provides steam irons, making a nice change from the usual hopeless ones provided. The hotel sits firmly in a residential area, with a lot of parkland nearby (we managed to spot some herons as we walked along the road!); it's near a small Jewish community, with two kosher restaurants and a kosher convenience store across the road from the hotel; there is also a lovely cafe perfect for cheap but delicious brunch a five minute walk towards Amsterdam Zuid, on the left-hand side of the road. Just past this there's also a shopping mall with supermarkets and other stores. Great deals can be found for this hotel, so there has to be a catch - and it's the hotel's distance from -anywhere-. If you're a business traveller, it's a nice fifteen minute stroll through a the residential area to the office complexes of Amsterdam Zuid. If you're a leisure traveller, however, it's a ten minute walk to the nearest tram stop, and then 15 minutes to the museum district, or 20-30 minutes to town. The hotel took great pains to explain how easy it was to get anywhere, and to be fair, the tram route does take you to pretty much any of the major tourist attractions. Schipol is only 6 minutes by train from Amsterdam Zuid. The hotel is still also relatively new, and as such is still 'bedding down' a bit. We had a fire alarm one morning that appeared to be caused by a fault. No apology was offered by the hotel (a little note slipped under the door from the management to explain and apologise would have been the very least I'd have expected). The fire alarm in my room also emitted a quiet high-pitch beep every two seconds - which a room transfer didn't solve, although to the hotel's credit, they did get an engineer out to fix it after a fair bit of complaining. So, would I return? Most definitely yes. I booked this hotel with one week's notice and got a 70 EUR / night rate. If you wanted a hotel of similar quality in central town, you'd easily be paying 120 - 180 EUR / night. So it's just a trade-off that you need to decide on. If you want to save money and don't mind a journey into town, then it's perfect - otherwise if you have money to burn then you would probably be happier elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but too far from Centre”
Reviews.Author: paycheck
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here because we got a very good deal from lastminute.com Â£10 per night but despite the hotel being new and very comfortable it was a bit too far from the city centre. Taxi from central station is aprox 15 euros , we used the tram which was 5.20 euros return but the nearest tram stop to the hotel is still a good 10 mins walk. Ideal for business clients but if city sightseeing is your purpose then choose a hotel nearer to the city centre. The hotel is on the main flight path for Schiphol airport but aircraft noise was not a problem. Not much in the area regards eating places or night life. Looked at the restaurant menu but choice was limited so so chose to dine out.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done hotel, but TOO far from EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: 123Travel123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over the new years period of 2008/2009. It was obvious that this was quite a new hotel - firstly by seeing how modern the rooms were and of course, there were zero reviews on Tripadvisor! Looking at Google Maps to get to the hotel from the closest station (Amsertdam Zuid), it showed the walking journey to be around 5 minutes. This is far from the truth! I timed the walk one night and it was almost 16 and a half minutes! A terrible walk in the freezing cold and of course the last thing you want to do after a very busy day and night. There is a tram stop about 12 minutes from there, but due to not knowing the city or how to get tram clipcards, we only used this on the last day. The only review I could find on this place was on their website, saying that it is close to restaurants and bars - this too is not true. There is zero nightlife there, but it is about an 8 minute walk to a small shopping centre. The rooms were very modern and spotless - lots of cupboard space and a nice size flat screen television. Very nice bathrooms - again very modern. The staff were quite helpful and were able to answer most of my questions. I got this hotel on a Mystery Hotel package, and of course it was alot cheaper because of that (and looking at around New Years, most places, even hostels, were costing quite a bit!). It was obvious the hotel was not particularly full (seemed maybe a quarter full), so this may be on a mystery package for a while. Yes, it is a 4 star hotel and I did get it at a good price considering, but looking at the excrutiating distance between there and anywhere, I would have rather paid a bit more to stay somewhere more central. It would have saved so much more time and seriously reduced the amount of stress a first time holiday brings! If you have a car, or are staying there for business in the area, it is definitely a good place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Musica
HotelInfo.Address: Van Leijenberghlaan 221, Amsterdam 1082, The Netherlands
